intro: Mirabilis albida, commonly known as the white four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Nyctaginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant produces vibrant white or pale pink blooms that emit a sweet scent, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mirabilis albida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
